alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gaines, western Borden and Dawson Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 742 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Welch, or 8 miles northwest of Lamesa, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lamesa, Welch, Lamesa Municipal Airport, Los Ybanez, Punkin Center, Arvana, Hancock and Key. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
